intro: Trichomanes caespitosum, commonly known as the tufted water fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is a small, delicate plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. The plant has a creeping rhizome with numerous short, upright fronds that are usually less than 10 centimeters in length. Its leaves are pinnately divided and have a distinctive, feathery appearance. Trichomanes caespitosum is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid, nutrient-rich soils.
